title: Naltrexone
summary: Naltrexone, sold under the brand names ReVia and Vivitrol among others, is a medication primarily used to manage alcohol or opioid use disorder by reducing cravings and feelings of euphoria associated with substance use disorder.[5] It has also been found to be effective in the treatment of other addictions and may be used for them off-label.[11] An opioid-dependent person should not receive naltrexone before detoxification.[5] It is taken by mouth or by injection into a muscle.[5] Effects begin within 30 minutes.[5] A decreased desire for opioids may take a few weeks to occur.[5]
